channel.title: Posts on Jack Lam
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Jack Lam

item.title: About Me
item.description: I am a graduate student at the University of Hawai ªi at Manoa. Currently, I am pursing a M.S. in Computer Science while being a Research Assistant for the Laboratory for Advanced Visualization and Applications (LAVA).

item.title: Destiny-class CyberCANOE
item.description: This was a project to build a new hybrid reality system in the Laboratory for Advanced Visualization and Applications (LAVA).

item.title: Effects of Parallax and Target Estimation
item.description: This was a project to see how having 20⁄20 visual acuity in a hybrid reality environment may impact a user’s distance estimation.

item.title: Attack on Algae
item.description: This was a group project involving computer scientists, animators, and marine biologists to produce a museum exhibit that teaches the public about the harm of algae in coral reefs at the Imiloa Astronomy Center of Hawaii.

item.title: Kale With Friends
item.description: This was a group project where we designed and implemented a website to bring consumers and farmers together.

item.title: Online Batch Scheduling Simulator
item.description: This was a group project to build an Online Batch Scheduling Simulator to study the performance of various algorithms.

item.title: Automated Sheet Music Translation
item.description: This was a group project where our goal was to build a Optical Music Recognition (OMR) system from scratch using the skills we learned in Computer Vision class.
